stream_context.summary: Kaze brainstorms and re-designs Course 15, originally a “space arcade,” into a Shy-Guy-run retro-futurist space-station with a giant bioluminescent space-squid boss that gates the rest of the level.

development_findings.summary: The public RTYI demo is complete but cannot be released because Parallel Launcher currently crashes on boot; Kaze is coordinating with its maintainer for a fix.
development_findings.quote: The RTYI demo is finished now. But there is a bug in Parallel Launcher that makes my ROM not boot.

development_findings.summary: Kaze scrapped the ‘space arcade with mini-games’ design after realizing it was unfun and thematically weak, pivoting to a Shy-Guy space-colony theme that retains space assets but adds narrative ‘placeness’.
development_findings.quote: We made the important realization that the idea we had for this level is terrible, and we're going to do something better.

development_findings.summary: New level flow: players first see but cannot reach three key areas (crop farm, water storage, rocket) because taxis are inactive; defeating a roaming space-squid boss unlocks those paths, creating clear goals and exploration incentives.
development_findings.quote: You have to climb through the level to the space squid, kill it, and then everything else in the level unlocks.

development_findings.summary: Concept for the space-squid boss: fight occurs on floating asteroids in low gravity; squid attacks destroy platforms on a timer and Mario must climb and hit its face.
development_findings.quote: Like a field of asteroids… you jump from asteroid to asteroid, it hits the one you're on… maybe you have to climb towards it and kick it in the face.

development_findings.summary: Large CRT ‘floating TVs’ will broadcast Shy-Guy propaganda—slow-motion footage of Mario killing Shy Guys with alien text overlays—to reinforce theme and provide animated set-dressing.
development_findings.quote: A video of Mario killing a shy guy in slow motion and the video turns red and then the CRT effect happens.

development_findings.summary: Console performance target remains 30 FPS; 60 FPS is deemed unrealistic for real hardware.
development_findings.quote: We are going to go for 30 on console. 60 on console is just unreasonable.

development_findings.summary: The overworld will be the entirety of Yoshi’s Island, gradually opening as players progress, with 6–9 secret levels and additional overworld stars for a Star Road-style exploratory hub.
development_findings.quote: The overworld in this game will be the entirety of Yoshi's Island… Right now there's 6 secret levels… I'm thinking of maybe turning that into 9.

development_findings.summary: Technical note: a custom camera is already in place; player opinions on it are considered subjective so it will likely stay as-is.
Biobak’s graphical trick: the sun texture’s UVs rotate based on camera pitch, creating a stylised lens-flare effect used in skyboxes.
development_findings.quote: You see the sun there, how it moves? It's a Biobak idea, but it's so good.

development_findings.summary: Kaze is researching legal avenues to monetise RTYI (e.g., physical soundtrack, cartridge) and would need to purchase music rights from Badub and consult a copyright lawyer.
development_findings.quote: I actually have crazy plans to maybe, hopefully, somehow monetize this game… I would have to pay Badub out for the rights to the music or something.

context_findings.summary: Kaze dislikes providing one-on-one technical assistance, finding it frustrating and time-consuming.
context_findings.quote: I'd rather just dip out than keep going back and forth with questions.

context_findings.summary: A spontaneous €500 donation boosted morale; Kaze intends to reinvest donations into paying contributors and development costs.
context_findings.quote: I do put a lot of the money I get donated back into the game… Gotta pay Biobak for his work.

context_findings.summary: He continues working professionally for Gears for Breakfast, which consumes significant time alongside RTYI.
context_findings.quote: I do still work for Gears for Breakfast… Takes a lot of my time.

context_findings.summary: Personal gripe: North-American breakfast cereals are overly sugary, but he eats them due to lack of alternatives.
context_findings.quote: I wish they had cereal with less chocolate in them, but they just don't.

context_findings.summary: He openly trolls the SM64 beta community for fun and has little interest in beta recreations.
context_findings.quote: I shitpost about the beta because there’s like so many small children interested in it and I think it's funny to shitpost about it.

context_findings.summary: Emotional arc during stream: visible frustration with current level (‘looks like ass’) followed by excitement after new concept emerges.
Design philosophy: avoid copying Super Mario Galaxy assets; accidental Sonic Adventure 2 parallels noted but aims for originality.
context_findings.quote: I kind of actively want to avoid looking at Galaxy while making this because I don't want to accidentally copy Galaxy.

biobak.summary: Came up with the rotating-UV sun effect used in skyboxes; ongoing primary graphics artist and will be paid for work.
biobak.quote: You see the sun there, how it moves? It's a Biobak idea, but it's so good.

badub.summary: Primary composer; soundtrack demos are on SoundCloud; name spelled B-A-D-O-O-P; Kaze may purchase music rights if the project is monetised.

key_stories.title: Arcade Theme Abandoned
key_stories.summary: Kaze spent weeks building a ‘space arcade’ with mini-game homages (Pac-Man, Donkey Kong) but realised during this stream that it felt forced and unfun. He publicly scrapped the concept in favour of a Shy-Guy space-station with stronger narrative cohesion.
key_stories.challenge: Level felt random and lacked ‘placeness’; arcade mini-games weren’t enjoyable.
key_stories.process: Live brainstorming with chat, listing what wasn’t working, analyzing player flow, comparing references, and sketching a new layout.
key_stories.outcome: Pivot to ‘Shy Sky Station’ with houses, taxis, crop & water farms, and a squid boss gating progression.
key_stories.key_quote: The problem is we're pushing the arcade theme too much and like no matter how we implement the arcade theme it's not gonna be fun.

key_stories.title: Parallel Launcher Roadblock
key_stories.summary: Although the public demo is content-complete, a launcher bug prevents it from booting. Kaze is troubleshooting with the maintainer.
key_stories.challenge: ROM fails to start in Parallel Launcher.
key_stories.process: Identified launcher issue, contacted maintainer, announced delay to viewers.
key_stories.outcome: Demo release postponed until fix is found.
key_stories.key_quote: There's a bug in Parallel Launcher that makes my ROM not boot.

key_stories.title: Surprise €500 Donation
key_stories.summary: Mid-stream, a viewer donated €500, surprising Kaze and prompting discussion on funding.
key_stories.challenge: Project relies on sporadic donations for contributor compensation.
key_stories.process: Acknowledged donor, explained that funds support Biobak and potentially musicians.
key_stories.outcome: Boosted morale and reaffirmed plan to reinvest in development.
key_stories.key_quote: That is extremely appreciated… I do put a lot of the money I get donated back into the game.
